description: Students encounter the theory of calculus and develop tools for communicating
mathematical ideas with technical accuracy and sophistication. The goal is mastery of the
concepts (e.g., limit, continuity, derivatives, and integrals) necessary to verify such
important results as the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, the Mean Value Theorem, and the
Bolzano-Weierstrass Theorem.  Emphasis is on theory and on developing the ability to
write proofs. Offered each semester. Also counts toward computer science mjaor. Prerequisite: MATH
or MATH 128, and MATH 220.  Permission of instructor required for first-year students.
